history.content: The 45 engineering units may come from any of the various CS / EE courses offered.

I'm afraid I don't understand your question, can you re-phrase it? Here are some quick bullets in case they help

  • 2 techs required per semester
  • 20 required upper division EECS units
  • 45 required CoE units. This includes EECS lower division requirements and the 20 upper division requirement (should leave you with 5 extra units)
  • design requirement
  • ethics requirment
  • 6 HSS courses including 2 R&C and 2 upper division
  • University and campus requirements
  • Math, physics, and one additional natural science course.
  • 120 units total

Something I'm curious about...I checked this website (http://engineering.berkeley.edu/academics/undergraduate-guide/academic-departments-programs/electrical-engineering-computer-sciences) and I see that it says the two technical electives I need to take amounts to 6 units. Where are the other 39 units coming from? I see 20 coming from cs courses...but I don't see anything else.
history.subject: Question Regarding EECS Curriculum
